channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Millionaire gets life for escort Georgina Symonds' murder
item.description: A millionaire has been sentenced to life in prison for murdering his £10,000-a-month personal escort after hearing she planned to leave him.

item.title: 'Worrying' waits for youth mental health services in Wales
item.description: More than one in 18 young people referred to mental health services in 2016 waited more than six months for a first appointment, a children's charity says.

item.title: Wales 'behind England' on tackling mobile 'not-spots'
item.description: Wales is lagging behind England in plugging mobile phone "not-spots" by easing restrictions on taller masts, the UK government claims.

item.title: George North: Northampton Saints avoid sanction over head injury
item.description: Northampton Saints escape sanction following a review into their treatment of George North's latest head injury.

item.title: Struggle over Tata steel pensions argument
item.description: A deal to change Tata's pension scheme is proving harder to sell to staff than was expected, BBC Wales understands.

item.title: Ioan Gruffudd: Edward I link for Hollywood actor
item.description: Hollywood actor Ioan Gruffudd discovers he is a direct descendant of Edward I, the king who conquered Wales, in a programme tracing his ancestry.

item.title: Woman arrested after girl hurt on busy Cardiff road
item.description: A woman is arrested of suspicion of causing serious injury by dangerous driving after a young girl was badly hurt on a busy Cardiff road.

item.title: Lynford Brewster: Three men jailed for Cardiff murder
item.description: Three men found guilty of killing a man in broad daylight in Cardiff are jailed for the "callous" murder.

item.title: Language row over Aberystwyth Marks and Spencer sign
item.description: An application for a sign at the site of a Marks and Spencer branch due to open next year is deferred after a row over translation.

item.title: Homelessness: Welsh councils given extra £6m from budget
item.description: Another £6m to tackle homelessness is being given to local councils in Wales as the budget is finalised.

item.title: Welsh Government to spend £19m on replacing south Wales schools
item.description: The Welsh Government announces plans to spend over £19m on two new school buildings for south Wales.

item.title: Parry's Christmas card travels about 600,000 miles
item.description: A family split between Wales and Australia has been sending each other the same Christmas card for more than 60 years.

item.title: Millionaire escort murderer tells police 'I done it'
item.description: Millionaire murderer Peter Morgan admits killing escort Georgina Symonds in a police interview at Ystrad Mynach Police Station.

item.title: Port Talbot steel workers 'worried for the future'
item.description: A deal to change Tata's pension scheme is proving harder to sell to staff than was expected, BBC Wales understands.

item.title: Mobile not-spots: No reason to lag behind, Cairns says
item.description: Wales is lagging behind England in plugging mobile phone "not-spots" by easing restrictions on taller masts, the UK government claims.

item.title: 'I'm like a puppet to mental health - I hear voices'
item.description: A teenager describes her experiences of mental health services after a charity says one in 18 young people waited more than six months for a first appointment.

item.title: Port Talbot steelworkers 'railroaded' over Tata deal
item.description: Some workers feel railroaded over a deal which could secure the future of Tata's Port Talbot steelworks for the next five years, it is claimed.

item.title: The journey of a Christmas card: From depot to Derek
item.description: BBC Wales sends a Christmas card to forecaster Derek Brockway and follows its journey.

item.title: Turning your ear helps you hear, Cardiff Uni study finds
item.description: It may seem obvious, but turning your ear towards a person when they talk can vastly improve the understanding of speech in noisy environments, scientists find.

item.title: Epileptic Nantymoel teen's appeal gets 700 birthday cards
item.description: A teenager with epilepsy receives more than 700 cards for her 18th birthday following an appeal by her family.

item.title: Miliwnydd yn euog o lofruddio ei gymar personol
item.description: Y miliwnydd Peter Morgan wedi ei gael yn euog o lofruddio ei gymar personol, Georgina Symonds ar ôl clywed ei bod yn bwriadu ei adael.

item.title: Iechyd meddwl plant: Elusen yr NSPCC yn pryderu
item.description: Yr NSPCC yn dweud eu bod yn poeni fod pobl ifanc yn gorfod disgwyl cyn cael apwyntiad ar ôl cael eu cyfeirio at wasanaethau iechyd meddwl.

item.title: Dolig y Sêr
item.description: Sut fydd rhai o enwogion Cymru yn dathlu'r Nadolig eleni?

item.title: Andrew Coombs angry at Newport Gwent Dragons over insurance issue
item.description: Retired Wales rugby player Andrew Coombs is "devastated" his former region Newport Gwent Dragons ended his insurance policy.

item.title: Cardiff Blues lock George Earle banned for eight weeks
item.description: Cardiff Blues lock George Earle is banned for eight weeks after making contact with the eye area of Bath's Tom Ellis in the European Challenge Cup.

item.title: Manon Lloyd: Welsh cyclist motivated by Team GB Olympic success
item.description: Welsh cyclist Manon Lloyd is inspired by the success of Great Britain's women's cyclists at the 2016 Rio Olympics.

item.title: Leigh Halfpenny: 'Attractive deal' to tempt Toulon star back to Wales
item.description: Pro Rugby Wales chief Mark Davies says "everything possible" will be done to bring Leigh Halfpenny back to Wales.

item.title: Millionaire and the escort
item.description: As a millionaire is found guilty of murdering his escort, how did he claim Asperger syndrome made him do it in what is believed to be the first case of its kind?

item.title: Your Pictures in Wales: 14-20 December 2016
item.description: A weekly selection of your pictures from around Wales.

item.title: The Greatest Gift
item.description: A documentary series about organ donation centred on a Cardiff hospital was the hardest to make emotionally for its producer.

item.title: 'Foodie' to Apprentice
item.description: Alana Spencer's rise from a "foodie family" to to winning The Apprentice.

item.title: Creative Cymru
item.description: How much of the creative industries' success in Wales is fuelled by government subsidy and ministerial intervention?

item.title: Dear Santa
item.description: More than two million cards, letters and parcel are sorted at Royal Mail's depot in Cardiff on Thursday - its busiest day of the year.
